alert.note: Alert for Lancaster; York (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 05 at 4:05PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Pennsylvania, including the following counties, Lancaster and York. * WHEN...Until 615 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 401 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Rainfall amounts have exceeded 2 inches per hour in isolated spots. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lancaster, York, Ephrata, Columbia, Millersville, Willow Street, Red Lion, New Holland, Spry, East Petersburg, Dallastown, Akron, East York, Leola, Stonybrook-Wilshire, Paradise, West York, Salunga-Landisville, Maytown and Shrewsbury. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
